artifacts.summary: Analysis of architectural gap between universal validity and semantic truth in finite models; documents that sorry is unfixable due to Box semantics quantifying over all histories

partial_progress.details: Research complete. The sorry is architecturally unfixable - recommend documenting as known limitation and using semantic_weak_completeness for sorry-free completeness proofs.

findings.reason: Forward truth lemma gap - Box semantics quantifies over ALL histories while MCS-derived states only carry information about ONE state
findings.alternative: Use semantic_weak_completeness from FMP/SemanticCanonicalModel.lean which is completely sorry-free and provides completeness via contrapositive
approaches_tried: MCSDerivedWorldState restriction (failed - Box still needs all histories)
Algebraic-Semantic bridge (failed - ultrafilter membership vs truth_at mismatch)
Hybrid completeness (failed - same forward truth lemma gap)

recommendations: Document sorry as architectural limitation (not a proof gap)
Direct users to semantic_weak_completeness for sorry-free completeness proofs
No implementation work needed - this is unfixable in current architecture
Consider marking task as ABANDONED with reason: architectural limitation
